dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Small, Canadian, rural. Just the Native American CASHIER jotting down sports stats from the paper. MARTIN, 16, enters. Slight, pale and frail, new clothes, a tag still hangs from his stiff work jacket. Martin stands in front of the Cashier a beat. Nervously tugs an earlobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. Sir, may I have a ticket to Montreal please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a ticket to Montreal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montreal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.     Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-three dollars. Martin pulls out an envelope filled with crisp twenties and carefully counts out three. The Cashier gives Martin his ticket and change. Points at a bus outside. The DRIVER loading bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half dozen PASSENGERS. Martin steps aboard, takes a seat. DAN SOULSBY, Martin's age, sits next to him, offers a hand. Martin shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan Soulsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin.     Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you heading to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from here.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dan produces a couple beers from his pockets.     Offers Martin one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pisswater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least it's cold pisswater. Here's to getting away. They CLINK CANS. The Driver enters the bus. Unlocks the airbrakes. Puts the bus in reverse, gives it gas. BOOM! The ENGINE throws a rod. Horrible GRINDING. Smoke wafts into the windows. The Driver KILLS the ENGINE. Silence. Martin and Dan trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was bad. (bummed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna take all day to get another bus here. Martin sighs, looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car rental place.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Martin fingers the envelope of cash in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a license?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had one.    They took it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got one.   Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Dan drives. JOURNEY ON the RADIO. Martin checks out Dan's guitar. Dan shows Martin his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that?    They're all fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take a hockey puck in the face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fist. My stepdad socked me. I flew across the room and dented the sheetrock in the kitchen. My mom saw everything and still took his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got cracked good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate that guy. Two hundred pounds of worthless grease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd he hit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wrecked his sixty-five Mustang and his boat in the same week. His babies. I totaled them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have popped you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was worth it. But I didn't deserve the tour in hell. Dan rubs his close-cropped hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever go to military school if you can help it. It sucks. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I jumped the wall two days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done with that racket. I'm going to Seattle and playing music. Martin tries the guitar, he's not that good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know some chords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you can learn drums?

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The land rolls endlessly. Martin drives.      Dan plays h guitar. He's really good. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the next Billy Squire. Krokus will be opening for me one day. POW! The CAR HITS a BOTTLE. A front tire deflates. Martin guides the crippled vehicle to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The middle of nowhere.    Martin flips a coin.    Heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Dan hauls the spare from the trunk.      Sets the jack un the bumper. A PICKUP TRUCK approaches.      Still a mile away. Martin watches Dan lean in the trunk for the tire iron. The pickup gets closer, a big one.      Heavy with bags o animal feed. Speeding. Martin looking at Dan's back. Martin shoves Dan hard, into the highway. In front of:

dialogues.speaker: THE GRILL OF THE PICKUP
dialogues.text: WHAM! It plasters Dan. He goes over the hood, SHATTERS the front WINDSHIELD. Bounces off, spins like a rag doll into a ditch. The pickup has lost control, it rolls.      Several times heaving mass of steel. CRASH! The TRUCK folds itself around a husky tree. survivors, that's clear.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: He can't believe what he has just done.       He takes in carnage, tugs at his ear.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: ESTABLISHING the river-bound city.      Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large Ferry plies the unstoppable waters.     Gliding toward skyscrapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The signs in French. Crowded with PASSENGERS waiting to board. As more PASSENGERS pour off the just-docked ship. A WOMAN runs through the crowd. Terror etched in her face. She knocks aside several PEOPLE. Runs toward a row of restaurants. Even in her turmoil, she is patrician, elegant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two BEAT COPS eat at an outdoor table.   Laid back.    Th WOMAN approaches them, frantic. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saw my dead son get off the ferry. The COPS trade looks. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me; he's been dead eighteen years. He just walked right past me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INSPECTOR pours the Woman tea. She has calmed down. He takes his pen, looking at her statement. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to open that grave.   It can't be my son in there. A beat. INSPECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost my mother two years ago. Every day I think I see her. Driving to work in the car next to me. At mass. Shopping, I see her, but this is someone else's mother. You see? The Woman lays a hand on his arm, looks him in the eye. There is something formidable about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector, I'm saddened by your loss and touched by loyalty. But let's focus on the matter at hand. He walked right past me. We made eye contact. I know he recognized me. It was my son. A mother knows these things. I will sign anything, I will swear before a judge. And thank you, I do have all my faculties and friends who can vouch for my character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you talk to this man, he is a man now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Of course he's a man. He'd be thirty-two. And no, I did not speak with him. I ran. (low, serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector, my son was very, very disturbed. He had serious emotional problems. I assure you he was. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is. Is a dangerous person. He hands her some forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame. The police department cannot resolve your problem. You need to get permits from the coroner and health and safety department. You pay for an exhumation. You have someone qualified examine the remains. If it is the wrong body, the Forensic Examiner will confirm there is a problem and call us. Then we open an investigation. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Quebec City police will investigate. He is buried there, no? The Woman bristles.     Stands, takes the forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Inspector. He is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep woods. In the mountains. Near a roaring river. log vacation cabin is being erected by CONSTRUCTION WORKERS. A BACK HOE digs a trench. The scoop snags something -- a wetsuit -- worn by a long dead corpse, twirling slowly, hanging from the bucket's steel teeth. The BACK HOE OPERATOR jumps off the huge machine, stares at the headless body he has just dragged from its grave. Workers gather and gawk. WORKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone call the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSPECTOR LAVAL and INSPECTOR REYNAUD, rock solid French Canadians, pin photographs of the body we just saw on the wall. Laval steps back. Takes in the display. INSPECTOR LAVAL (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think she will like this? Reynaud shrugs.    Laval tosses him a Newsweek. INSPECTOR LAVAL (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are lucky the FBI is sending her. She is the Michael Jordan of criminal profiling. (off Reynaud's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guy Le Fleuer of profiling. She will save our ass. The PHONE RINGS.   Laval answers. INSPECTOR LAVAL (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector Laval. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the airline check again. Look around baggage claim. (to Reynaud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was on the flight but they can't find her. Reynaud's CELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui? Reynaud grabs his coat.     Turns to Laval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where she is.

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS
dialogues.text: We hear BREATHING and the SOFT RUSH of a RIVER.        So rhythmic. Then FOOTSTEPS. Two eyes open, reflect moonlight.      The FOOTSTEPS draw closer. CLICK!     A FLASHLIGHT turns on.   REVEALING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE VANDERHOLT lies in the grave where the body was discovered. It has been excavated by criminologists, the soil sifted, the grass and brush removed. Grace sits up. Grace holds out her FBI creds, shielding her eyes from the bright light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, I'm supposed to be here. CLICK.     The LIGHT goes off.   REVEALING Laval and Reyn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Vanderholt, we requested your help. I'm Inspector Laval, this is Inspector Reynaud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Look, I'm not ready to talk to you guys yet. I need a little more time here. Reynaud and Laval trade looks, walk toward two UNIFORMS guarding the site.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grace lays back down. Sighs. Concentrates on the sounds. The RIVER. WIND in the trees. Then: LAUGHTER (O.S.).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind trading one liners somewhere else? I need to hear the natural sounds. I appreciate it. The policemen have gathered in a chummy knot.    Laval gestures for them to walk down the road.

dialogues.speaker: ON GRACE
dialogues.text: She steps out of the grave. Sits by it. Writes some notes. Everything glistens in the moonlight, alive. Grace takes it in for a beat. Then:   HOWLING, the lonely song of a distant WOLF. Grace rises, crosses to the river, to a big gravel bar. Used as a campsite complete with a large fire pit. Grace sits by the fire pit. More HOWLING, CLOSER this time. Grace looks down river, SEES the glowing eyes of a TIMBER WOLF staring from a clump of trees. The animal stares a beat, then runs off. Grace has the chills. Grace walks quietly toward the trees. Grace just a few feet away. RUSTLING. She cautiously moves aside a sapling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TIMBER WOLF nestled amidst the trees gnaws on something; a HUMAN HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace stands there alone, the wolf is long gone. She stoops, pushes aside brush. She finds a hollow under some roots. Grace CLICKS on her FLASHLIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A human skull stares up from the hollow.     Picked clean weathered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laval and Reynaud, and the two UNIFORMS smoke and joke. A quiet beat as the WIND picks up. Their cars up the road in the b.g. SOMETHING MOVES in the woods.   Inspector Reynaud draws his Glock. SHUSHES the men. A beat. MOVEMENT. Laval signals for the men to spread out. Holsters are UNSNAPPED. Reynaud is all eyes and ears as he picks his way toward the trees. GRACE emerges from the trees, a laser-aiming dot on her forehead. She REACTS to Reynaud, raises her hands. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot, I'm on your team. Reynaud holsters his gun.   The men relax.   Grace takes Inspector Laval aside. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call who you have to call.   I found his head. Laval REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloved hands carefully remove the skull from a box. The MEDICAL EXAMINER places the skull on an exam table and begins cleaning it. Grace walks around the headless body. The wetsuit has been removed, the body has been autopsied. Headless, skeletal hands, the legs are surprisingly well-preserved. DIRECTOR GILLET is tall, heavy, smoking a cigar.    He's cop's cop and all-around nice guy. DIRECTOR GILLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you how excited we are to have you here. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only have one victim. Usually there's two or three by the time I get called in. DIRECTOR GILLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This case made page one of the Globe. The tabloids say there is a headhunter on the loose. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor wants closure. That's his vacation house they were building. I get calls from supervisors I didn't know I had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You clear the Mayor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cleared the Mayor. He read the article on you in Newsweek and insisted we fly you up. The papers say two campers had a drunken fight and the loser lost his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't solve crimes anymore, I balance budgets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was not a heat of the moment killing. And the victim was buried complete with head. The grave was five-foot ten. The victim's height. With square corners. Dug with a shovel the killer had the foresight to bring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five detectives searched the area Saturday. My investigators think you're a witch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been called worse. The Medical Examiner finds two small holes in the skull, waves the PHOTOGRAPHER over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez. Look at that, looks like he got ice-picked. She simulates fangs with her hands, they match marks on the skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. A large canine did that. Probably an old or sick timber wolf that couldn't hunt. It dug up the body and chewed off the head. It felt safe in the trees, away from the riverbank, away from the other wolves. The Medical examiner looks at a chewed vertebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say you're right. (into tape recorder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Postmortem scavenger damage to C-1. The Medical Examiner examines the skull's teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The victim was afraid of dentists. Bad teeth. Inspectors Laval and Reynaud enter. Both give Grace wary nods. Inspector Laval hands the Medical Examiner a paper bag marked HUMAN REMAINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was a meter from the skull. At soil level. The Medical Examiner opens the bag. Removes a wig. No, not a wig; someone's ponytail and leathered scalp. Tangled with the hair is a braid of green nylon cord tied to two pieces of broomstick. The Photographer SNAPS some shots. The Medical Examiner gingerly untangles the cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. Grace crosses, grins.      Grace studies the cord, noting intricate knots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo.   That's your murder weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be trash a camper left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Look at it, braided parachute cord, two pieces of broom stick. You approach the victim from behind, loop it around his head and hold on for all your might. The more the victim struggles, the quicker he passes out. And now you have convenient handles to drag around two hundred pounds of dead kayaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what it is. A theory. That evidence supports. When the suspect is in custody you can ask him yourself what happened and you won't need me. Inspector. Laval bristles, he crosses to check his cell messages. Gillet looks at Grace, at the cord. Turns to her quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laval and Reynaud are my stars. Very smart, very persistent investigators. On the street; they're magnificent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that Director.   You're lucky to have them. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Director, say what you have to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the expert. If you have any suggestions on how to proceed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. A forensic anthropologist can draw the victim's face based on the skull. I know someone at Quantico who can do it by tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call 'em. Then show the results to everybody around who was selling outdoor goods two years ago. You have his initials; MRC, inside the wetsuit. The long hair is distinctive, someone may recognize him. It's a semi-long shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's bread and butter detective work. Thank you. (checks his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should get upstairs. They cross to the exit. Director Gillet barks orders in FRENCH at his two-star Inspectors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photos, maps, newspaper articles cover the walls. Twenty-four Hour News ON a TV. Six DETECTIVES man the phones. ROOKIES fetch reports, pour coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The long table is crowded. Inspectors Laval and Reynaud. Three more POLICE OFFICIALS. A pair of CITY COUNCILMEN. Grace sits next to Gillet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found the skull. Incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a case once where wild dogs had removed remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I can tell my people there isn't a headhunter running around the wilds of Quebec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No headhunters, sir.   However, a killer is out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director Gillet. Do you have the victim identified?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No name yet, sir. We have someone from the University recreating his face from the skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, after two years, has nobody reported him missing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't missed. He had no family, or moved often. He had the musculature of a serious outdoorsman. He spent a lot of time in his kayak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big question is who killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always is, sir. I can give you a rough profile; white male, thirty to thirty-four. Has some college but no degree. Neat in appearance. At least six feet tall. Very intelligent. Charming when necessary. He uses murder as a tool, probably in furtherance of a criminal endeavor. He's killed before and will again unless caught. Laval and Reynaud write furiously.     Gillet is impresse As are the Councilmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really appreciate the FBI sending you. When can we expect your report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple days, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace writes notes on a yellow pad. Inspectors Laval and Reynaud cross, Laval shows her an artist's sketch of the victim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to a dead man. INSERT SKETCH: The victim has a deep stare, rugged features, long hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame.   Good-looking guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is more than we had. Thank you. Laval has declared peace.      Grace smiles.   Reynaud st keeps his distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very nice bed and breakfast. Grace enters and finds her luggage waiting. She loves the room. Antiques, art. Grace finds a bottle of wine and a note from Gillet. She smiles. Grace checks the mini fridge; bingo. Cracks a Moosehead. Her CELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanderholt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We named the victim; Curtis Kohler. The forensic dentist just verified the ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a C?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. K-O-H-L-E-R. The initials are for the Montreal River Company. Kohler worked there as a guide three years ago. The owner remembers him because he stole the wetsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do a full records search? Criminal, credit, commercial history. Transcripts. Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an awesome investigator, Inspector. Run his name on every database you can. I'll see you in the morning. Grace hangs up. Makes notes on the sketch.       Slips it into a picture frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, Reynaud and Laval look through a haystack of computer printouts for needles of information. Grace stretches. Grabs a donut from a box. Offers the box to Laval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fruit of the Gods. You know you want one. Laval gives in, takes a plain cake. She offers donuts to Reynaud. He rubs his eyes, shoves aside papers, quietly to Laval:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take her down the street. I will not eat one of those hockey pucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go down the street. Very good food. We are inviting you. Please. Grace grabs her jacket and an armful of reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locals only. The Inspector's favorite spot, they are like family here. Grace, Laval and Reynaud at a table in back. Covered with reports and plates. Grace stops reading. Tosses aside a printout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kohler has been dead two years. No doubt about that. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very solid time of death. Two years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So before he died he got his paychecks, paid his taxes. Patronized sporting goods stores. And had long spending gaps where he was enjoying the great outdoors. That pattern continues a year after his death. He gets some paychecks. Rents an apartment. Buys a three thousand dollar kayak. Pays his taxes. Dead and buried and still paying his taxes. Then everything stops. Last Visa charge was to Travelocity for a plane ticket to Mexico city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead men don't pay their bills. It's identity theft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't someone renting limos and fancy dinners on someone else's credit. Lifestyle and habits don't change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer error?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many independent systems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We work organized crime sometimes, maybe a hit man wanted to lay low. He assumed the life of a civilian until things cooled off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think a gangster is going to break his stride and become a long hair groovy river guide? Inspector, this guy's whole life has been stolen. Someone killed him and became him. Down to profession and taste in clothing. Laval and Reynaud trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are still on, Grace has fallen asleep on her bed, still in her clothes, paperwork everywhere. Case photos now fill the picture frames, cover the walls, even on the ceiling. KNOCKING at the door. Grace stirs. Crosses to the door, groggy. She checks the peephole. Cracks the door. It's Inspector Laval. INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a heavy sleeper. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're everywhere. What's up, Laval? INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man was killed tonight. Attacked from behind. Asphyxiated with a nylon cord with handles. And there's a witness. Or a suspect. We're not sure yet. We should go.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Cop cars everywhere. Crime scene tape. The Coroner's van. A couple NEWS CAMERAMEN. Grace crossing with Laval. Reynaud places a HANDCUFFED MAN in workout gear in the back of a cop car. INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.   He says he saw the killer. Reynaud SLAPS the cop car, it quickly drives away. Grace and Laval arrive at a BODY dressed in sweats. A gym bag nearby. A pair of UNIFORMS stand guard as a CRIMINALIST processes the body. Thirty-ish, healthy, his generic looks marred by bulging, bruised eyes. Face bruised. INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet Mr. Todd Ford. Grace squats by the body. CLICKS on her Mag-Lite and inspects the victim. Bruises on his neck. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still warm.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grace shines her flashlight along the corpse.      A coup hairs glow in the strong light beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to get those? The Criminalist takes a lint roller, collects the hairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.   Under his car. Grace shines her light under a car. A garrote is there, made of broomsticks and knotted nylon cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.   Has Le Directeur been notified?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm letting the poor man sleep a couple more minutes. (pointing things out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-four hour gym is there, next door. He has a membership card in his wallet. That's his car. Car keys. Grace looks around the garage.      Taking it all in. Getting a feel for the scene. She carefully examines the victim's car with her flashlight. The door has been brushed with black print dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director Gillet sips bad coffee in a rumpled suit and T- shirt. Looking through a two-way mirror. Grace, Reynaud are with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that our killer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. So far he checks out as an art dealer from Winnipeg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN COSTA, 33, sits at the small table. Glasses, moppish hair. Laval sits across from him. Costa is sincere, and frightened. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walk out of the gym. Walk to my car. I'm unlocking it and I hear a scuffle, a fight. Over by this car I see this guy getting choked from behind and I shouted. INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you shout? COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Stop.' I ran towards them. Then the person doing the choking lets go and pointed a gun at me and ran. I'm so stupid. I could of been shot. I called the police gave him CPR until the paramedics came. INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You touched him? COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.   I was giving him CPR. INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You removed the Garrote? COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing around his neck? Yes. I took it off, it was choking him. INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see where the attacker went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from me. INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of gun did he have? COSTA (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind that puts really big holes in people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it black?    Was it silver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, see? I am getting information. He had a large black handgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. I can draw a picture of his face. I saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to draw a picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sketch. I can sketch him.     I'm very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you see his face in the dark? A beat. Costa realizing he is under suspicion.        He forward, looks Inspector Laval in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not do this. I saw two guys fighting and should of ran the other way but I didn't. (as if to a child)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to find the person who killed this man. (in French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to find the guy who did this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace doesn't like the turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to confirm he's a suspect or clear him and kick-start a manhunt based on Costa's ID. If he is a legit witness, he'll get heated up and start forgetting details. I think there's a way to clear him without pissing him off. May I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grace KNOCKS on the Interview room door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector.   I need a moment with you. Laval exits the room, shutting the door behind them. A ROOKIE hands Director Gillet a cup of coffee and a new dress shirt wrapped in plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was getting into his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a shortcut. Can you get any of his school transcripts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.   It's all on-line. Grace takes an evidence bag containing the garrote from the latest crime scene. She drops it in her computer bag. Grabs a case file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the Winnipeg Police and have them fax or e-mail his driver's license photo. Grace crosses, opens the door, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Costa smiles at Grace as she enters.        Sets her on the floor. The case file on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you guys are playing bad cop smart cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm the dumb one. Agent Vanderholt. Call me Grace. They shake.    She slides typing paper and a pencil over Costa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He had these real intense eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Costa about to start drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Before you do that, I need some personal information from you. Can you write down the name of the elementary school you attended? And your elementary school teachers, as many as you can remember. Costa looking at Grace a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? Lady, I saw someone get killed tonight and you're asking me about grade school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize, I know it's random, but it's the best way you can help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember any of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Mr. Costa. You'd be surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I attended two. Holy Trinity and Mother of Good Counsel. I remember Sister Bernard. And. I don't know, Father Jeffrey. Mr. Johansen. Oh, and Mrs. Sebastien, she had a glass eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I? She takes the list of names. She tips over her briefcase with her foot, the evidence bag spills out. Costa glances at the garrote, REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod.   That's it, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing around his neck. Costa looking at Grace, realizes it's a mind game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told the other guy, I'll tell you. I did not do this. Grace. I saw who did this and I can show you what he looks like and you can go catch him. Costa is unambiguously sincere. Grace's attitude softens a bit. She tucks the garrote back in her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and draw the face of the man you saw. Costa draws a simple smiley face.     He shows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get an artist to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can draw him, thank you. Grace crosses to the door.     Costa begins drawing in earnest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace emerges from the interrogation room. Reynaud hands her a printout of Costa's school records. Grace checking Costa's list against his transcripts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left a file in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. See if he tries to peek in it. The real killer couldn't resist. He'll want to know what we know. Laval watches Costa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa draws with skilled hands, delicate but strong. file is ignored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace hands Laval back Costa's file. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you remember any of your grade school teachers? He remembered three. A Rookie crosses with a photo, hands it to Laval. INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's his provincial driver's license photo. He's checking out. Laval shows Grace the photo.   It is definitely Costa. beat. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nurse take a DNA sample. Just to make sure his DNA isn't in the victim's car or anything weird. INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll run the tests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa has finished the sketch. He holds it up to the mirror, for those he assumes are watching. REFLECTED in the two-way mirror is COSTA'S SKETCH.   Cold piercing eyes, chiseled features. The door opens, expecting Grace, Costa is disappointed to see a tough-looking PARAMEDIC unwrapping a cotton swab. PARAMEDIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please open your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: THE SKETCH is taped to the dashboard, now labeled: UNKNOWN ASSAILANT. The cops cruise the business district, eyeballing the arriving OFFICE WORKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE slams an espresso shot as she reads the Globe. INSERT HEADLINE:   MONTREAL MAN MURDERED OUTSIDE GYM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is his personal space, tons of hockey paraphernalia. A couple tired easy chairs. The Medical Examiner eats a slice of pizza. Grace studies an evidence bag containing a man's ring. MEDICAL EXAMINER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fell out of his T-shirt when I removed the clothing. It doesn't fit the victim. GRACE (off the ring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WVSS.   1995. What's that? MEDICAL EXAMINER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West Vancouver Secondary School Class of '95. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CWE? Whose initials?   Not the victim's. MEDICAL EXAMINER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I called the school and had someone find them in a yearbook. Here's the original owner's name. But it could have been through a dozen pawn shops since then. He hands her a piece of paper.   Grace has a big smile. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor, can I take you back to Quantico with me? MEDICAL EXAMINER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I must remain where the hockey is good. Grace hands the paper to Reynaud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynaud and Grace crossing through the parking lot. INSPECTOR REYNAUD (into radio, subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Special Unit Fourteen. I want a complete name search. Clark William. Surname is Edwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector Reynaud. Can we swing by the crime scene before we head back? Reynaud nods:     yes.    They get in his unmarked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tape still up. The 24 Hour gym is closed for the day. Grace looking around. Laval studies a shrine of candles on the sidewalk. Grace sneaks up on him. She gets real close.       Laval watches the candles burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector. Laval startles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere a second, please. They cross to the victim's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borrow your keys? Stand there like you're going to choke me. Grace pantomimes unlocking the door, drops the keys and reaches for her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keys drop straight down, how'd they end up over there under that car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were kicked. During the struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Kick them as hard as you can that way. Laval looks at her, kicks his keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even halfway.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grace crosses to the candles.     Laval follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had this case. This young hundred-pound woman was abducted from a parking lot. She kicked off a mirror, broke a window, dented her door. She struggled. This guy? Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything you are saying, you are saying one thing, do we trust Costa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question.  Do we trust Costa? An unmarked car pulls up.     Reynaud drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Grace and Laval get in, Reynaud guns it.       Grace belt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found a current address here in Montreal. Reynaud leans on the HORN, aggressively maneuvering through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys have an extra weapon? I didn't want to cross the border armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glove box. Grace opens it and finds a compact Glock.       She check shoves it into her pocket. Reynaud swerves into the wrong lane. Stops cold in front of an apartment building. And gets out. Great driving. A mere two blocks away from the crime scene.       Laval out. Then Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An upper floor. Grace, Reynaud and the MANAGER cross to a door. The Manager studies Costa's sketch of the attacker. SUPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never met him. We conducted our business by phone. They arrive at a door. Reynaud about to knock.   Grace stops him, listening at the door. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smell smoke. Back where I'm from anyone can kick a door if there's a fire. It's the 'citizen's arrest' of search warrants. Then: The SMOKE ALARM inside the apartment BUZZES O.S. Reynaud and Laval trade looks. Reynaud cocks a leg... The Manager unlocks the door a beat before Reynaud kicks it. Laval is no danger junkie, he's a little hesitant to enter. Grace gets down low, enters carefully, she knows what she's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark, drawn shades. A small studio. Reynaud and Grace move tactically with drawn guns. Grace enters the kitchen. Light smoke. Reynaud approaches the futon, a person-sized shape under the blankets. Reynaud whips aside the blanket. Just pillows. Grace checks under the sink. Reynaud checks the bathroom and shower. A coffee pot smokes, SIZZLING sludge on the bottom. Grace checks around the fridge, now satisfied no one lurks in there. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear. Grace turns off the burner. She crosses to a window, whips aside the curtains, and opens it. Coughing. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh.   Got a lung full.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grace looks at a glass of orange juice, a half-eaten plate of food on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like this guy ran out in the middle of breakfast. Laval has entered, he stares out the window.      Grace l out the window, REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment window has a perfect view of the gym parking lot where the killing occurred.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Reynaud sees that and also REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should get out of here. Don't touch anything. They back out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace watches a CRIMINALIST bag a comb from the medicine cabinet. A couple hairs entwined in its teeth. In the kitchen another CRIMINALIST dusts for prints. Reynaud taking pictures with a large still camera. Laval KNOCKS on the walls. Laval moves a picture frame. A photograph falls out. Laval picks it up with surgical gloves. INSERT PHOTO: A dead ringer for Costa's sketch, carousing in a Thai bar. Laval shows Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resembles the man Costa sketched. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you released him? You don't want your star witness steaming in a holding cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went home twenty minutes ago. Agent Grace, where do you think Monsieur Edwards is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet Monsieur Edwards is in a deep grave with square corners like Messieurs Kohler and Ford. Which looks like all the victims. Maybe he's subconsciously killing himself. Grace finds a guitar case. Opens it. It's a mobile office; it has postage stamps. Postcards. Assorted stationery, different address labels. Neat, organized. Holiday cards. A CD titled: "Learn Flamenco Guitar." Hundreds of practice signatures. Forged documents. Victim's personal effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take that with us. (in French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a number and seal on that case. Reynaud SNAPS pictures of the guitar case. Grace is absorbing everything this little apartment can tell her. Bonding with the space. She smells a pillow. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever see a Hermit crab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a crab that lives in the shells of dead sea snails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. They have one big claw and curl up tight. Laval takes a long, sharpened screwdriver from his jacket. Begins prying off a door molding. Grace sits at the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they outgrow an old shell, they search for a new empty shell, crawl up to it and quickly switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They live in these beautiful shells because they have these soft ugly bodies. They couldn't survive without the shells. Neither can the guy we're after. Laval exposes several MINI DV and MICRO-CASSETTES hidden under the molding.

dialogues.speaker: A TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: Surprisingly clear video shot with a long night-vision lens. TODD FORD exits the 24 Hour Gym, gets in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Director, Grace, Reynaud and Laval watch the video on the TV. Director Gillet turns it off. He is not in a good mood and that has Laval and Reynaud on edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could have had him this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director, please. We are getting close. The hairs recovered from the apartment match the hairs recovered at the crime scene on Ford's body. We found hours of video like that of the victim. He has been following him, filming him for weeks. He tapped his phone and has recordings of Ford's calls. Even a CD with copies of Mr. Ford's E-mail folders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that much detail, you could become anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he hunts people and wears their lives as a kind of trophy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like a kind of camouflage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his real name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know what he looks like, we have his fingerprints, we know what he had for breakfast. But his name eludes us still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find it, Laval. Find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Laval and Reynaud quickly exit.     Grace stays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director Gillet and Grace walk down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're working really hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone died last night because the asshole we're after isn't in custody. It's happened to me before and I'm sure it will happen again. It's a pretty miserable feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't felt it in a long time. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I promised the boys I'd hang out tonight. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, Reynaud and Laval have mussels and beer.      Lava watches the GUITARIST, a little melancholy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fair and I keep my promises. My informants trust me. I have eyes on the trains, on the buses. If they see him, they will tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they will tell you. Why do you trust junkies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (makes a fist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust their fear of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I was a street cop in Philadelphia for three years before I joined the FBI. Grace speaks French.      Reynaud REACTS.    As does Lava

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice.   You like to play games. Grace smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ford worked as a cruise-ship musician. He would walk around and play his guitar on the decks at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is pretty cold sometimes. Man's just trying to spread a little music and gets murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He targeted Mr. Ford the night before he was supposed to get on a plane and meet a ship in Aruba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the new improved Mr. Ford was going to meet he ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think he has a plan B?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it. He's been so meticulous and effective in the past, I bet he's never needed one. We can assume he has all sorts of fake IDs and passports. Disguises. But that's not enough for him, he has to be someone else. He gets off impersonating people. And he knows his current persona is compromised. Laval and Reynaud have stopped eating, are looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're always thinking. Save something for tomorrow. We have three boxes of evidence to go through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty cavalier attitude for a man who just got his ass chewed by his boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My papa dropped dead of a heart attack in front of a drill press at work. Not me. Grace understands.     Laval CLINKS her beer, Reynaud too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dropping by Costa's, I still have a couple questions. (off Laval's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warm night, people are out. TEENS, COUPLES. Some OLD MEN argue politics. Grace approaches the gallery, keeping a low profile as she finds an angle to look inside.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (MOS)
dialogues.text: John Costa shares some Merlot with a statuesque ELEGANT WOMAN. She's laughing, flirting. Costa is making her laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace quickly crosses to the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: An OLDER MAN joins them, the woman is his arm candy. Costa shakes his hand. The Older Man and the Elegant Woman exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace enters. Costa sees her, REACTS, genuinely glad to see her. And that throws Grace a beat. She really likes his smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Costa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You caught me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. Grace looks over the art. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toussant Jean Bernard. I met him in Haiti last year. Very troubled life. Outlived all his children. And he had ten. He lost his wife to cancer and went blind. Passed away last year. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overpriced folk art. Is it the work of a soul that has suffered? Sure. Are his explorations as an artist groundbreaking? No. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch. And I was going to send you two and charge them to your Amex. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't afford it. Costa is looking at her, looking through her. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Daddy's Amex? I've sold quite a bit of art to poor little rich girls like you.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grace grows tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try the wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm partial to beer. And I don't have long. I came by to thank you for your help. And I apologize if you were detained. You did the right thing. Trying to save him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, thank you. Agent Vanderholt. (gives her a card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a show Friday. You should come by and meet some good people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows.   Where'd you learn CPR?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medical school. Before I dropped out. I had a moment of clarity: in anatomy class I realized I'd rather draw bodies than cut them up. And when I realized I couldn't make art, I decided to sell it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some journey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's taken me all over the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Monday again, did you see Mr. Ford fighting back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I thought I was interrupting something, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they were hugging. Then the gun came out when he saw me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's it. Thanks. Grace hands him a card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you remember any details or need anything. (off his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything related to the case, please call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Think about Friday. Please, Grace? Grace will; she exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace has turned the romantic little room into a cave of paperwork. Notes and photos cover the walls. Grace reads a phone bill taped to a lamp. Circles a number that keeps reappearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is gearing up for a new day. Grace crosses to where Laval and Reynaud struggle awake with coffee and the morning paper. Grace takes a seat, grabs the sports section. A YOUNG DETECTIVE eats a grapefruit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning. Can you run this name? She got twenty hang-up calls from Edward's phone. The Young Detective takes a Post-It from Grace and crosses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to that beautiful thumbprint on the orange juice glass, you get an ID?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No hits. He's never been fingerprinted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Any activity on Edward's accounts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I think he became Edwards a year ago. He was a software engineer. Did everything by the internet, he never met anyone face to face. Grace trades Reynaud for the front page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why a year ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edwards went on a river trip. Kohler was a guide. Grace REACTS.     Laval tosses her some papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are E-mails between Kohler and Edwards discussing the trip one year ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You connected Edwards and Kohler? Somebody was working all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our suspect kills Kohler on the river, lives his life a year, kills Edwards and assumes his ID for a year. Then he stalks Ford, kills him but is interrupted by Costa. Think he's pissed at Costa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. The Young Detective returns with a report, hands it to Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Vanderholt, a report came back on the name.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Laval drives fast through a neat, modest neighborhood. Grace marveling at the police report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must have sounded like a total fruitcake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. Grace watching Laval.      He looks pretty rough this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go and be non-threatening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNOCKING on the front door. The WOMAN from the ferry answers the door. Her name is REBECCA ASHER. She opens the door, smiles warmly at Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, please come in. Thank you for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Classy decor. Grace sips Earl Grey.       Admires the impressive antiques.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad they finally sent someone, those hang-up calls have me terrified. They started right after I saw him. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked him directly in the eye. There was a moment of mutual recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's Martin calling and hanging up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It couldn't sound crazier, but who else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you ever asked to identify his body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body? Yes, they showed me some remains that had been hit by a pickup truck. The upper body was crushed. There was no face. I got physically ill. Mrs. Asher studies Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not Canadian, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I'm with the FBI. Grace shows her creds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was three. About two weeks ago. I began turning off my telephone when I go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have some very nice things, Mrs. Asher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Some of them have been in my family for several generations. Please call me Rebecca. Grace looking at pictures on the wall of a good-looking, athletic kid. They stop at age fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Martin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's Reese. Martin's older brother. He drowned in a terrible accident. Grace notes a photo of a smiling young REESE receiving a long distance swimming trophy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, Rebecca.    How did he drown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The San Michel River. Martin fell out of their raft and Reese jumped in to save him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a lot of snowmelt that year. Martin reached the bank. Reese didn't. It was their fourteenth birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their fourteenth birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were twins. Identical twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said Reese was older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By three minutes. They were very different boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To lose one son so young, then to lose the other two years later; to think you've lost him. That must have been devastating. Mrs. Asher lights a cigarette. Crosses to the window, so poised, so tragic. Grace studies her with a critical eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese was very charismatic and outgoing. Martin was introverted. He never thrived like Reese. He was a very disturbed young man. Reese was Martin's world. Martin never recovered his equilibrium after we lost him. He changed. Martin began to intimidate me. He could be very menacing. He began imitating Reese at school and that lead to fights with other students. At sixteen he stole some jewelry that was very precious to me and ran away. A few days later the Thunder Bay police called and said my son had been killed changing a tire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police want you to sign this so they can exhume the body in Martin's grave and verify identity.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mrs. Asher takes the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll sign it. I already know somebody else's son is in that casket. The PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Mrs. Asher crosses to the kitchen and answers. Grace looking around, takes a look down a hallway. LAUGHTER O.S. as Mrs. Asher chats with a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace pokes her head in, looks around.     Nothing of not

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Grace peers in. Flowing silk, throw pillows, like a Sultan's tent. Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace opens the door. Bingo. More LAUGHTER O.S. A bed, still made. Old toys. Sports equipment. An "R" on the headboard. On the other side; shadows on the wall where pictures used to hang. Indents in the carpet. Where a bed used to be. Grace's brow furrows.     Martin has been erased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GROWLING. Grace turns. Sees a diminutive DOBERMAN SNARLING at her. The miniature hound guards a door. A door with several locks.    Grace takes a step toward i The tiny dog bares its fangs. Grace reaches for a deadbolt. The little DOG GROWLING. One deadbolt is open. CLICK. Grace opens the other one.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grace cracks the door.       Darkness, stairs leading to basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom is there. Grace startles.        Mrs. Asher is right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.     I was snooping. Grace closes the door.       Mrs. Asher escorts Grace awa past the boys' room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the boys' room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends call it the shrine.     It can be difficult to let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's killing people, isn't he? Grace nods:     yes.     Mrs. Asher assumed as much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't surprise you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   It doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Grace gets in. Laval shaving with an electrical razor. Laval pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lady is definitely a queen without a country. I should have curtsied. (watches him shave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hygiene on the road. Very efficient. The razor dies.        Leaving Laval half-shaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grace trying not to laugh, hands him a form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She signed.   Start digging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A back hoe rips a bucket of earth from amidst the graves. A couple UNIFORMS watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cheap wood coffin sits on a gurney. The lid has been removed. Grace, Laval and Reynaud peer inside and REACT. Reynaud looks ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. Could be worse after getting run over by a pickup and twenty years in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body has been moved to the exam table. Covered with mold the corpse seems to be upholstered with baby blue velvet. The Medical Examiner checks the scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodies get mixed up all the time. Police found the wallet, called the mother and nothing was cross- checked. This was his head. Medical Examiner pulls a plastic bag from the coffin. Slices it open, revealing skull fragments and teeth. Passes them off to an ASSISTANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the assistant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that to Doctor Shivani and make sure someone signs for it. (to Grace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll rebuild his jaw line and check it against Martin Asher's dental X-rays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a priority case, this afternoon maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five XL-sized COPS pump iron before their shift. CAMERA FINDS GRACE. She's doing sit-ups on a decline bench, holding a 25- pound plate to her chest. She's a machine. Sweating. Intense. The cops can't help but to be impressed. Grace's CELL RINGS. She doesn't stop, does sit-ups faster. At the last second she answers. GRACE (into phone, panting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanderholt. INSPECTOR LAVAL (V.O.) (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I interrupting something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   What? INSPECTOR LAVAL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The X-rays don't match. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the real Martin Asher. He's your killer. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get his mother someplace safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An UNMARKED parked with Laval and Grace inside.     They watch:

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: MRS. ASHER checking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd she finagle a room there? INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a very slick woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't have one picture of Martin. Not one. Even cut him out of the old yearbooks. And she had a basement door like a vault. She's hiding something. In the basement of her house. What is it, ten minutes away from here? Her house. A beat.   Laval looks at Grace, decides he can trust her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's under our protection and something happens to her house, her belongings, the department could be liable. There could be a lawsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. We should make sure her front door is locked. Laval makes a U-turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens. Revealing Grace, and Laval as he pockets a lockpick gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay outside. Kill him if he's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll get 'em. Grace enters with a flashlight and a pistol. She cautiously clears each room until she is sure she is alone. Grace crosses to the hallway. The little dog is there. GROWLING. Grace tosses it a hamburger patty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's be friends. The dog happily attacks its treat as Grace opens the deadbolts on the door the little dog was guarding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace descends CREAKING STOPS. Shining her light around. Old boxes. Furniture. Forgotten things. Dust. Grace is looking for something and she's not sure what. She spots a door chain. She moves some boxes. Finds a leather razor strop hanging next to a small door. Grace's hand undoes the chain. Lifts the latch and opens the door as rusted HINGES SQUEAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace moves aside cobwebs with her big flashlight. The room is tiny. Exposed joists overhead. Grace sits on the cold concrete. A sleeping bag rolled in the corner. One wall is just chicken wire. Her flashlight beam stabs at the yawning darkness beneath the house. There is a public school desk chair combo. The name MARTIN neatly carved into it, then scratched out. A broken light bulb overhead, its wires running to a corner of the house. Grace cautiously unrolls the sleeping bag. A pair of socks, underwear, T-shirt neatly folded inside. She rolls it back up. Finds a large jar, picks it up. Very old feces inside, a makeshift toilet. She sets it down. Grace pulls the door shut.   And turns off her flashlight Pitch black. So quiet. She sits there, in the musty little cage. Listening to her BREATHING, to her HEART BEAT. So lonely, so frightening. A tear rolls down her cheek. She SNIFFLES, wipes away the tear. A beat. Grace hears SCRATCHING. She clicks on her light.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE'S FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: YOUNG MARTIN ASHER IS HUDDLED in the corner, shivering, CRYING and WHIMPERING. Martin looks AT us with haunted eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace REACTS, nothing is there. Chuckles for scaring herself. Grace feels the chicken wire. MORE SCRATCHING. Grace freezes. Listening carefully. Mice? SOMETHING moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She swings her flashlight on:       TWO FIERY EYES. WHAM! Something big slams into the chicken wire. Teeth flashing, GROWLING. It's a BADGER. Grace almost shoots it. The fearless beast GROWLS. Grace kicks the door open and runs out of there.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Laval driving back to Montreal.      Grace is shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I just shaved ten years off my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, you do feel fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Rabies scares me.     Only rabies. Nothing else. Her CELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanderholt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace. Someone broke into my office. Minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the art gallery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   My office here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they still there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me to call you if anything happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be right there. I'm sending a car. Don't touch anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two POLICE CRUISERS SCREECH to a stop outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooden painting crates everywhere. A table saw for making frames. Costa is distressed. Grace looking at a message typed onto his computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do all my calls to Europe and shipping stuff at night. My address book was on the screen when I went out for coffee. I came back and this was on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long were you gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes. Maybe. When I returned, that was on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: FRERS ON RUE CHAUCER. CU
dialogues.text: Reynaud takes a picture of the screen. Laval checking the door's lock. Finds no marks. Gives Costa a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this about the strangling?   Is that guy after me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please relax, Mr. Costa. We don't know if there's a connection yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anything missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Everything's here. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. He took my organizer and my business checkbook. Grace nods for Laval to step outside with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Laval. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know Costa didn't stage this? For attention or something. INSPECTOR LAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's happy to see you. But the alarm was jumpered. Do you think Costa knows how to jumper an alarm? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should take the computer. Costa who has followed them out, overheard. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take the computer.    That's my brain. Costa turns to Grace. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not making this up.     Believe me. Grace shrugs, sees an ATM facing the alley. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I believe you? Grace crosses to the ATM.   Peers into its security camera. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or should I believe this. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe what you want. He's cocky, Grace likes that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being fast forwarded. COSTA exits his office.        Lock door. He walks TOWARD CAMERA and EXITS FRAME. A MAN'S SILHOUETTE in the alley. Crossing towards the office door. An ATM CUSTOMER blocks the shot. The ATM customer moves on.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nobody is there.     Then: MARTIN ASHER exits Costa's office. Closes the door. APPROACHES CAMERA, nonchalant. His face is clear; the piercing eyes, the sharp features. Asher EXITS FRAME. Fast forward some more until Costa ENTERS FRAME and crosses to his office with a cup of coffee. The VIDEO STOPS. It REWINDS. FREEZES ON ASHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa, Grace, Laval and Reynaud. Costa stands there looking at Asher's image on the video monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the man you saw choking Mr. Ford? Fear flashes across Costa's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must of walked right past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Costa, is that the man you saw kill Mr. Ford in the parking lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. That's him. That is the man I saw murder Todd Ford in the parking lot outside my gym. No doubt. Now will you go catch him, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.   I just needed you to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this guy? He's like a Ninja. Sneaking into my office. How dangerous is he? Does he want to kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, no harm will come to you. Listen to me. No harm will come to you. I promise. Anyone who wants to hurt you will have to get through these two for starters.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She gestures at Laval and Reynaud.     Costa turns to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many people have you killed? Reynaud shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be safe, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want you to be there tonight. A beat, Costa smiles.     Realizes she's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not meeting him. Absolutely not. You ever go fishing? The bait always dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't get within fifty feet of you. The second we see him, the cuffs go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa gives Grace a look as Reynaud tapes a microphone to the BODY ARMOR he is wearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he shoots me in the head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will take the bullet for you like the Secret Service. Okay, friend? Reynaud is serious.     Grace helps Costa with his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good. You could move a lot of art if you wanted to. Their eyes meet for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And inspire some too, I'm sure. Right then something very rare happens; Grace blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ultra-hip. The dance floor THROBS with CLUBGOERS.      TH DJ THUMPS a EUROBEAT. Costa sits at the bar. PEOPLE all around him, jostling to buy drinks. Two busy BARTENDERS sling booze. Costa finds the noise and crowd absolutely nerve- wracking. He twirls the ice in his Scotch with a finger. Staring at the clock. 1:31 AM. He's nervous, sweat beads his forehead. A big BARTENDER, an undercover cop, pours Costa a Scotch. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.   You're doing fine. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you look any more like a cop? BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I have some water?    I'm cooking in this thing. Costa scratches around the neck of the hot BODY ARMOR. The Bartender gives him a Dasani. VARIOUS ANGLES: A half-dozen UNDERCOVERS are mixed in with the CLUBGOERS. CAMERA FINDS Reynaud sitting at the bar near Costa, gives Costa a reassuring nod through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked outside the club. Grace and Laval watch Costa via the TV built into the dash. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa fits Asher's choice of victims. Travels the World looking for art. Single. No kids or anything. (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher's here somewhere. Watching. With all the patience in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had his patience. He should be a cop. His mother should be punished. Like the owner of pit bulls that attack kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't keep them in a cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa looks miserable. Overheating, anxiously nursing his water. He looks around. Then REACTS. A note sits on the bar top. Right in front of him. Costa looks around. Only sees strange faces. Costa carefully unfolds the note.       It reads:   "MEET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa walks down a narrow hallway. Paint peeling. MUTED. Red light bulbs hanging from the ceiling. Approaching the men's room, Costa looks over his shoulder. No one is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa cautiously pushes open the door. Stepping inside. Dingy tiles. DRIPPING FAUCET. Several stalls. The room seems empty. Costa swallows, bends down. Checks under the stalls. Nothing. Nothing. Nothing... Then. Something. At the far stall. A pair of men's shoes. Black. Polished. Facing the stall door. Waiting... Costa freezes.     Backs away as... The stall door slowly swings open. HINGES CREAK.        A foot, a trouser cuff. A leg stepping out...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A BLACK MAN emerges.       One of the guys at the end of bar. Costa exhales.        A bundle of nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go outside. Costa eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're calling it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa bursts from the fire exit, fed up. He rips off the wire, he struggles out of the body armor. Grace and Laval watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a life. I can't play superhero for you. I don't handle stress very well. I have an art show to open tomorrow and I don't know what I'm putting on the walls yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you have a life. So did the people who have lost theirs. Someone else might die if you do not help us. Every time someone dies it affects forty, fifty lives. Costa looks at her, arms on his hips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, I've been cooperating. I even drew you a picture. You can't put your responsibility on me. You have a badge, not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
