dialogues.text: If somebody else dies, and you know you could have done more to stop it, you're going to feel like shit for a very long time, Mr. Costa. A beat.   That resonates with Costa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to help you guys but I don't have time to hang out and listen to bad techno. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay to be scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared? I'm off-the-charts terrified. There's a pissed-off serial killer after me. I mean, what did I do to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw him and that's enough. Don't stop living your life. You'll be protected by armed officers twenty-four seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until he's caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't promise you that. Costa is torn, Grace empathizes with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a lot of work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car is watching the gallery. You'll be okay. Costa looking at Grace.     He decides to trust her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director Gillet leans against a wall, smoking a pipe. Grace, Laval, Reynaud sit on the tired couches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who was in Asher's grave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan Soulsby. He went missing from the Alberta Military Institute two days before the accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure Soulsby's death was a homicide, Asher saw the opportunity and took it. He became Soulsby and bummed around Seattle for a couple years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is Asher after Costa? Why isn't he in Mexico getting a new face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa saw him. Costa caught him in the act, caught him being Martin Asher. Seen first by his mother, then by Costa. For the first time he's failed at taking a life, and since we found the apartment, he can't be Edwards. To be seen, to be recognized, is a horrifying thing to Asher. He has no identity and wants it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the real Mr. Edwards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likely dead and buried south of the border somewhere. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South of the American border somewhere. Visa records put Asher, using Kohler's ID and Edwards at a Mexican surf resort. Edwards' last charge was sixteen hundred dollars at a 'no questions asked' facelift clinic in Guadalajara. Director Gillet taps out his pipe.     Looks at a new, mo detailed portrait of Asher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you contacted the clinic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They are also 'no questions answered.' Mr. Kohler suddenly paid off his credit card bills, thanks to money from Edwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep's the collection agencies off the trail. How do we flush Mr. Asher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's focused on Costa. Who fits the profile of Asher's victims. He went on Costa's computer and E- mailed copies of Costa's files to an E-mail account in Denmark. Constant threat of discovery, Asher will become more disorganized. Laval and Reynaud agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. My office will arrange a press conference. I will tell a room full of correspondents we have a suspect who is dead and murder victims who are alive. And I'll sound like a madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does sound crazy. That's what the press likes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director Gillet stands tall before a podium. Blinded by lights. A bouquet of microphones in his face. Beside him is a haunting poster-sized portrait of Martin Asher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Asher, we know who you really are. We will find you and we will arrest you. You can hide no longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Posters advertise SUMMERFEST.     CITY WORKERS put up barricades and porto-potties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two CARPENTERS uncrate and hang paintings.

dialogues.speaker: ON COSTA
dialogues.text: Lost in thought. He studies a series of vivid paintings leaning against the wall. He crosses. Changes the order. Steps back. Something isn't right. CARPENTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Costa, some men in that car have been watching this place all morning. The Carpenters looking out the window. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're protecting the art. Go ahead and hang those. Be very careful. CARPENTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir. Costa hears a POLICE RADIO. Spins around. Grace and Reynaud have entered. Costa is apprehensive. What now? Grace gives him a reassuring smile. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security is going to be very solid tonight. She waves him out of earshot of the Carpenters.     Their faces are close. Grace gets butterflies. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he going to show up tonight? What do I do, offer him a drink? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't show. But we want to be here in case he does. Four plainclothes officers will form a perimeter watching the four corners. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perimeter, excellent. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And four plainclothes officers will be in here. Mingling. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mingling? I don't need four bruisers crashing through my clientele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officers will be very discreet. We won't interfere with your thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With my thing.    Will you be mingling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.     If you feel safer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much safer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summerfest, a street festival, is just warming up. could be Mardi Gras, plastic cups and glowsticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cutting edge club feel. A DJ spins a captivating mellow mix. The gallery is filled PATRONS ABUZZ with chit-chat. Inspector Laval and Reynaud study the patrons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This painting costs more than my house. Reynaud shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: FIND GRACE
dialogues.text: She's stunning and shy about it. She examines a painting. A gentle hand touches her back. She turns. It's Costa. He hands her a highball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look a little anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: her dress)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all you. Grace gives Costa a look.       She sips her drink, nods the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to get into the show, but I mean. What is this? It looks like somebody napalmed the Garden of Eden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mangos.   Ripe mangos hanging on a branch. Now she sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Why the borders? Almost every painting has one. Was he in prison or something? Costa REACTS, impressed by Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people don't notice. This is from his prison series. He could see a mango grove through his cell window. He made some of the pigments himself. From flowers. From his own blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was his crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He attacked his neighbor with a machete. There was a woman involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always is. Grace sips her drink, letting herself relax.       She en Costa's company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a lot of lovers, didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens. He was a consumer of life's pleasures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he's dead and you get rich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His children formed a corporation, I take ten percent. I'm not a buccaneer, Grace. Grace looks at Costa and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I've ever met anyone quite like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very sensitive for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An FBI agent? The ELEGANT WOMAN spots Costa and crosses. She lays a hand on Costa's shoulder. He turns and they kiss cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, it's amazing tonight. I want to cry, I'm so touched. Grace watches her hand linger on Costa's arm. And is amazed that she feels jealous. She catches Costa's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Costa, I would like to discuss an arrangement for the series. The Elegant Woman REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a sec, John. She crosses to the Older Man in b.g.       Costa is miffe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not writing the checks. The Elegant Woman returns with the Older Man.       He gr Costa's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, it's incredible what you've put together. (aside to Costa)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing we were talking about the other day, well I'd like to proceed. Hell, I'm sick of making two percent in the market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick, they're yours. The Older Man smiles, shakes Costa's hand. The Elegant Woman looking at Grace, arms crossed, enjoys her victory. Grace plays along, stalks off, hiding a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few minutes later Costa finds Grace at the turntables looking through the DJ's records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you miss wax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You helped me close the biggest sale of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my cut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? Grace smiles coyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Costa looks at Grace for a long beat.      Not sure what game is, or if he wants to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know when you do.   Excuse me. Costa walks away.     Grace REACTS; she didn't want that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa takes a leak.     He's in a good mood.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The window above the stalls is open. The noise of the PARTYING CROWD on the sidewalks outside. Costa finishes, washes his hands.        Pauses.    Smoot hair.

dialogues.speaker: SOMEONE BEHIND HIM
dialogues.text: Costa looks in the mirror and REACTS. MARTIN ASHER stares at him from the mirror. No doubt who it is. Asher is wound tight, not at all happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your hands on the wall. Asher jams a gun in Costa's back.        Costa is very sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please be cool with that.    I don't wanna get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should blow your spine out. My face is everywhere. I have to hide in the shadows like a fucking animal because of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir. I apologize for everything you think I may have done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're moved past sorry. You ruined everything. John, soon to be dead, Costa. Asher's eyes flash. WHAM! Asher slams Costa's face into the mirror. Costa's nose bleeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynaud stands near the bathroom. He heard that. approaches the door, tests the knob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Costa hits the deck. Asher spins, aims at Reynaud and FIRES. POP-POP-POP-POP! Reynaud drops and rolls out of the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher bursts from the bathroom, running right over Reynaud, who draws his pistol. Grace pulls a pistol, Laval too. Asher running through the patrons. Grace takes a knee and aims. She doesn't have a clear shot. Asher aims his gun straight ahead as he runs. People hit the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of my way! POP! Asher SHOOTS a WINDOW, SHATTERING it. He shoulders his way through the safety glass. Grace and Laval follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. Summerfest is in full swing. A swirling, boiling CROWD of shiny faces. Asher dives into their midst. Grace plunges in after him. Inspector Laval follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa is stunned, Reynaud checks him for bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. From Reynaud's radio: INSPECTOR LAVAL (V.O.) (filtered, subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean, he ran into the damn crowd. Reynaud bolts out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher and his pursuers leave a wake of disturbed REVELERS that Reynaud follows. Asher running. Careening, rolling, bouncing off PEOPLE. He has the tireless power of a soccer player.

dialogues.speaker: ON GRACE
dialogues.text: Running.   Equally tireless.      Locked onto Asher like missile. Grace is slowly gaining on Asher. Laval behind her.      Running.   Screaming in his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're heading East. Form a line at Seychelles. A dozen UNIFORMS charge through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police RADIOS busy with CHATTER. UNIFORMS clear a path for two PATROL CARS. SIRENS WHOOP as they coast in, TAP bumpers, blocking the intersection. POLICE OFFICERS form a formidable skirmish line. SHOUTING for REVELERS to move aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher running. Gun in his pocket. Elbowing his way through the crowd. Asher REACTS. He sees the gauntlet of UNIFORMS and PATROL CARS blocking the intersection ahead. Asher shoves his hand in his pocket...

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Thunderous GUNFIRE. Grace hits the deck. The Uniforms hit the deck. The CROWD SCREAMS, CLAPS and WHISTLES. It's not gunfire... TILT UP. FIREWORKS unfold in the night sky like giant flowers of fire. Rivers of sparks. Grace recovers her feet with palpable relief, she thought she was dead for a second. Grace looking around for Asher. Laval reaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.     You see him? POP-POP-BOOM! More fireworks.         Laval gestures for Uniforms to spread out.

dialogues.speaker: A SHRILL SCREAM O.S.
dialogues.text: From an apartment building. Grace runs into the building. Laval follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Laval running.   More SCREAMING O.S.    They ru upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An UPSET WOMAN is in the hall, standing by the just-been kicked-in door of her apartment. Grace and Laval charge inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SLIDING GLASS DOOR to the balcony has been shattered. Below and beyond is a long rooftop. Madly lit by a swirl of bright lights. A huge outdoor dance floor throbs with energy in a park along the St. Lawrence River.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE SEES --
dialogues.text: ASHER jump from the far end of the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laval will go no further. Grace gets a running start, jumps from the apartment window, tucks and rolls. On her feet again, Grace sprints along the roof. FIREWORKS BOOM and POP overhead.   THUMPING TECHNO. Grace reaches the edge of the roof.     REACTS.   Reynaud caught up with her.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Asher has vanished into a vast sea of DANCERS, adorned with strobing and glowing jewelry. The BEAT dominates all sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Reynaud trade looks, tenacious street cops at heart, they holster their guns and jump into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: FIND ASHER --
dialogues.text: A dozen yards away. He stalks a dancing RAVER who wears a huge bundle of glowing necklaces. Asher snatches necklaces.   Disappears into a wall of DANCERS.

dialogues.speaker: FIND GRACE --
dialogues.text: She and Reynaud scan the moving bodies for Asher. Grace GLIMPSES the back of Asher's head. Grace and Reynaud tear through the crowd like bulls, working together, a bonding moment. Asher is an arm's length ahead of Grace. She reaches out, her fingers snag the cloth of his shirt. Asher turns... IT'S NOT ASHER. Grace shoves him aside and moves on. She SEES a disturbance up ahead. Grace shoulders her way through the crowd. Grace and Reynaud converge on the disturbance.    They cleave through ONLOOKERS to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: A FIGHT
dialogues.text: Two drunk COLLEGE JOCKS slug it out. Grace looks around; no Asher. Angry, frustrated, Grace grabs one of the Jocks, hurls him to the ground. Six UNIFORMS swarm in and arrest the two Jocks. Reynaud throws up his arms in frustration.    He looks at Grace, they know they've been beaten.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal Grace and Reynaud surrounded by an ocean of bodies in motion. CAMERA FINDS A DANCER. Some dude with his shirt off grinds on three HOTTIES. PUSH IN ON THE DANCER.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's Asher. His face is an evil green from his mane of pilfered gel glow necklaces. Red plastic cup in hand, Asher enjoys the boisterous anonymity.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER'S EYES
dialogues.text: Dangerous and cold.     They track Grace as she moves through the crowd. Asher grabs one of the hotties, begins making out with her. Grace searching the crowd.    Scanning faces. Grace passes within feet of Asher. Asher smirks.     Now another hottie wants a kiss.   Ashe complies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late. Costa has a beer, his nose bandaged. INSPECTORS finish up questioning PATRONS. Grace enters, crosses to Costa. She's tense, wound tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a ride home? Costa looks at her. Despite everything, his face shows he is glad to see Grace.

dialogues.speaker: LATE NIGHT
dialogues.text: Grace drives.     Costa in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night started out great. Everything gelled. Everyone was happy. You helped land a big fish and the feeding frenzy started. Six figure pieces were flying off the wall. (shivers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he was going to blow out my spine. I was thinking surgery. Six months in bed. Exercise pools. Never walking again. Grace looks at him.     Costa is worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was in my bathroom and none of you could stop him. I need to leave town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That might be a good idea. Until then I'll check under your bed for monsters. Costa looks at her.     Grace gives him a warm, open star

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would appreciate that very much. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I profile you? I read your book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-something, single white female. Best schools best grades. Discovers adrenaline policing the inner city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, stop it. Please. Let's shift the conversation from me and my business onto something inbounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Are you going to my funeral when Martin Asher cuts my throat? They both know she's been lowballing the threat. We can tell Grace is truly concerned for Costa's welfare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let him get away. Grace takes that hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No excuses.   I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant you in the general sense. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you catch him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got his name. We catch everyone sooner or later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spacious, lofty.     Costa and Grace enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. Costa scoots aside a pile of clothing.       The newspape Cool art, sketches, images all over the walls. Reminiscent of Grace's hotel room. And a very cool view of downtown. Grace taking everything in. Art books, sketch pads. Piled high on the desk. She looks at the ceiling. SEES notes and sketches taped up. Grace laughs to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It's a sty.    Must be a profiling mother lode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done profiling you.   I got you figured out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A failed healer, a failed artist. Grace looking at a drawing on the wall.       Costa wince didn't want her to notice it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that how you see yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's you. I did it last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how you see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's how I think you see yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how do you see me? Costa licks his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be out of bounds. Grace looking at him. Costa looking at her. A staring match. Costa and Grace try not to laugh. They end up giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. John, games are fun. But head games are dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then keep your head out of it. A beat.   Grace shrugs, back to business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Justice minister is going to relocate you to another city until Mr. Asher is in custody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what your deal is. One second you're so there, then all I get is the badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize if you've been getting the wrong signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Relocate where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another province. They want you on a flight tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This monster comes into my life and I have to leave? A UNIFORM SERGEANT enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My people are in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sergeant. The Sergeant exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is surreal. What do I pack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you need.   Movers can get the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need tomorrow morning to finish up my business here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let them know. This is goodbye.     Neither of them feels very good abou it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to check under my bed. Grace smiles, plays along, crosses, looks under the bed, stretching for Costa. Driving him nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No monsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Grace holds out her hand.      They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I probably won't see you again until the trial. If there is a trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, then. Costa leans across her, braces himself against the wall. A bold move. Now they are eye to eye. Grace kisses Costa for a long beat. Grace breaks the kiss. Holds a finger to her lips; shhh. She turns and exits. The door shuts behind her. Costa is going to miss Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next morning. Laval pulls up in UNMARKED #1, next to the patrol car that has been guarding Costa's apartment. With a wave the UNIFORM behind the wheel drives off. Laval exits his car. Crosses to Costa's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynaud and Grace have just pulled to the curb a half block away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynaud behind the wheel, turns to Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spent a lot of time with Costa. Grace isn't sure if that's an accusation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like him.   He's a good guy. Grace smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laval RINGING the bell. A white PLUMBER'S VAN pulls up behind Laval's unmarked. A PLUMBER gets out.    Coveralls, clipboard.    Crosses t another apartment. Costa opens the door. With two packed bags.       Laval t one. Costa takes one last look at his home.       Locks t door. Laval watches the plumber KNOCKING a couple doors down. Costa and Laval cross to unmarked #1. The plumber approaches them.     Costa looking at him, REACTS. The plumber is MARTIN ASHER. A gun in his hand.       Lav drops Costa's bag, reaches for his holster... POP-POP-POP!    Asher drops Laval with three to the face.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Costa stares in disbelief at the mortally wounded cop. Asher shoves Costa into the driver's seat of unmarked #1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynaud GUNS IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa behind the wheel.        Asher in the passenger sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just shot a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.   Go! Costa hits the gas and pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREECH! Reynaud slides to a stop. Leaps from the still-moving car and checks his friend Laval. Who is no more. Grace wants to get Asher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You staying or going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving. Grace slides behind the wheel.          And takes off in muscular cop car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa driving. Scared to death. Asher has the gun in his lap aimed at Costa's face. Asher looks exhausted. Hounded. Asher notes the police radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, he was a cop. He's dead because of you, because you made the choice. The choice to fuck with me. That, John, was a very bad choice. A T intersection ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way?   Left, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left. Costa makes the turn.     It leads to a HIGHWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead, John Costa. You fucked with the wrong man, shitsmear. Costa is shaking, looks in the rearview.      Asher rips rearview off the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm flooring it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.   Faster. Costa pulls onto the highway, buckles his safety belt. Asher scoffs at the gesture, then does likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your wallet.   Give it over. Right now. Costa does. Asher looks through it, pockets it.      Cost tries to focus on driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goddamn right I am. I've been dreaming about it, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace FLOORING IT.      Sails onto the highway.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TWO-LANE HIGHWAY- DAY
dialogues.text: Costa's unmarked races northward, out of the city. Grace catching up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa gets stuck behind a slow-moving truck. ASHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass the truck, John.    Before I blow your head off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God help me. Costa swings out to pass the truck.

dialogues.speaker: AN ONCOMING TRUCK
dialogues.text: A head-on imminent.    The Buick swerves onto the shoulde Just missing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace watches Costa's unmarked SCRAPE past the truck. side mirror is knocked off. The oncoming Buick swerves back onto the asphalt. Overcompensates, now heading right for Grace... Grace REACTS, swerves. BAM!   The cars hit.   Grace gets a face full of airbag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace's car spins off the road. Stops in a ditch.       A beat. The Buick's hulk blocking the road. Grace exits the unmarked. Dazed but unhurt. She crosses to the Buick. Three HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS are in the car. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everyone okay? They seem alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod, I have to call my mom. A POLICE CAR SCREECHES to a stop. Then another POLICE CAR. Grace runs to one of the police cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're okay. Let's go. (points up the road)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just shot a cop. Grace jumps in the passenger seat.        The COP looking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.   Bad guy's that way. The Cop nods, PUNCHES IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa is driving towards the mountains.        Driving th the pine forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.   Turn there. A hard-to-see side road. Costa JAMS the BRAKES to make the turn. Asher SLAPS him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Sorry. Sorry.      You don't want to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do. John, do you have any idea how many people I have killed? It's always been business. This time is personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please be cool. C'mon, we don't even know each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Art Man. You are stupid or crazy or both. Will you drive faster? I'll shoot you in the thigh. Will that get your attention. Costa speeds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't, man. I got money. You want money, I'll give you money. I got paintings. What do you want? Talk to me, Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not Martin. There is no Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. No Martin. What do you want? What's my life worth to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. And everything. This is deeper than money. Shut up. Talk is done. Talk is over. Understand that. You are over. Just shut the fuck up. Asher lights a cigarette.     A sharp turn ahead.    Cost speeding up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, please, Martin.   Martin.   Be cool. Asher aims his pistol at Costa's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is Martin? Costa sets his brow in determination; he is driving straight at a large tree... Asher REACTS. Costa jams his thumb into the release button of Asher's seatbelt... Asher angrily pulls the trigger of his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The unmarked car hits the tree... POW!   Airbags deploy. Costa's body is slammed by crash forces but stays put... Asher goes over his airbag.     Asher's head goes through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Cop GUNS it into the mountains.       A fork in the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way do I turn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way's the river?   Go to the river. The Cop makes a right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oil smoke and steam pour from the unmarked #1.       Cost alive, cut bad. He looks at Asher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rot in hell, Martin Asher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher's head is stuck through the windshield, his throat cut bad by glass. He's alive. Asher panic-sucks deep breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa undoes his safety belt.       Grabs the door handle The door pops open. Costa pulls himself from the wreck.       Flames spread u the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race along a mountain road with a view of the St. Lawrence River below. They can see far up the road, no sign of the unmarked #1. Grace looks behind them, reacts.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A COLUMN OF SMOKE rises from behind a ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa lays by the road.     Motionless, he may be hurt ba

dialogues.speaker: UNMARKED
dialogues.text: is now Martin Asher's funeral pyre. Flames engulf everything. Even the glass is melting. BOOM!   A TIRE EXPLODES. Costa stirs, crawls on his hands and knees, into the road away from the wreck. POP-POP-POP!   AMMUNITION in the unmarked EXPLODES from the heat. A police car arrives.    SCREECHES to a stop alongside Costa. Grace leaps from the passenger side. She grabs Costa, helps him into the back. POP-POP-POP! More AMMO COOKING OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Cop backs up fast.     BOOM!   Another tire.   Now th tree has caught fire. Grace examines Costa, running her hands over Costa's battered body. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing broken? COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my hand is broken.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grace looks at it.      There is no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move, okay. Presses his split scalp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God yes.   Stop that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to the hospital. You'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very dead. Costa relaxes significantly. He realizes Grace is holding him in his arms. So does Grace. It feels good. A FIRE ENGINE heading to the crash passes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crime scene tape. POLICEMEN form a perimeter. The fire is out. A Fire Truck pumps water for a three-man HOSE TEAM cooling the hot metal. A plume of steam rises up the scorched tree trunk. The car is nothing more than blackened sheet metal. Asher has been reduced to a charred torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynaud sits by himself, his head between his knees. Mourning Laval, dead on a nearby gurney. Director Gillet crosses to him. Lays a comforting hand on Reynaud's shoulder. Reynaud sees who it is, stands crisply, wipes his tears, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Jean. I called your wife. I'm having someone take you home to her. There is nothing left to do here. Reynaud doesn't want to leave his dead comrade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ordering you home. Reynaud acquiesces.     A Uniform escorts him out of ther Director Gillet crosses to Grace, who was watching him. She sips coffee, an icepack on her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really good with people. Gillet shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Mr. Costa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got off light. With a broken wrist and fifty stitches. Lucky man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My luck has run out. Until today I have never had to bury a friend. Grace squeezes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thankfully it's over. We have our man. Asher's DNA matched the hairs recovered on Ford's body and in the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa's scalp is being stitched shut. Costa's wrist is in a splint. She watches the DOCTOR sew flesh for a beat. A KNOCK.     Grace enters.   Grace smiles warmly at Costa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. (winces)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch, Doc. That's not rawhide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll inject more anesthetic. Grace leans against the wall, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.    Thank you for rescuing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime. Do you know where he was taking you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To my grave.    He was going to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take you out tonight. Let's have some fun. I owe you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's fun for you? You want to go to the shooting range or the morgue? Grace is hurt by that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to   take a couple days to depose you   and get a full statement. I    thought you might enjoy a break   before you have to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a place. You drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ultra mellow. Grace and Costa chill on throw-pillows and tapestries. Persian trip-hop and hookahs. Grace and Costa have melted into a corner where they sip tea. Nobody has been more comfortable. Costa pours beer from a pitcher. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy to be alive but it's like this door has been opened.      I don't think I was naive. But everything is different now. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll fold this experience into your life and be stronger for it. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you deal with it? All the misery and pain and violence. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can stop monsters, John.     And because I can, I have to. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is it a calling or a curse? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither.   It's just my job. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was in med school I saw a guy on a Harley get T-boned by a Daihatsu. He was screaming in pain and needed help and I knew what to do, I had all my certs, but I saw all this blood and froze. I failed the big test. Bye-bye, med school. Hello, graphic design. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy Wilson. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man on the Harley. Costa REACTS.   Sighs. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you knew about that. No wonder you knew what to say to keep me cooperating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a sharp one, John Costa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You threw me in a tiger cage like a piece of meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. You were the cheese in the trap. We stopped a monster. That's what matters. Grace is utterly unapologetic.      It makes Costa like h even more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is in manic cleaning mode. She pulls papers off the walls. Shoves a pile of clothing in the closet. Sweeps coffee cups into a wastebasket. She opens the door for Costa. He enters.        The room still a mess, but it feels safe, cozy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   I'm a pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust anyone who's too organized. Grace puts some MUSIC ON the CLOCK RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. She grabs a couple cold ones from the mini-fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is it, are you a runner or chaser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People like you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, people like you. Hardcore. Gung-ho people like you. And you know what I mean. People like you are either runners or chasers. Grace looks at Costa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a trip, John Costa. He's not letting her off the hook.       She plays along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I guess I'm running and chasing. Costa REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   I didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Growing up I quit speaking after that. I didn't say a word for three years. When you're not in the conversation, you get forgotten real quick. So I'd watch people. Study them. The mouth can say anything, but the body doesn't lie. The tilt of the head, the way the hands move. Grace draws closer.       Costa watching her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get your voice back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day my Uncle died. The truth exploded out of me like a vision. My Uncle and Father had been arguing, there was a gunshot and my father was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are very intense, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember my Uncle telling me not to say anything. And I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made myself forget why. The day he died my voice and my memory came back. I screamed for an hour. Very primal. I haven't shut up since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did your Uncle do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Land. Great-grandpa owned half of Pennsylvania. My Uncle wanted control and sold it all. All that's left is an old farmhouse and a horse pasture. (sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father's murderer got away with it because I couldn't open my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a hell of a lot of responsibility for you to put on the shoulders of an eight-year-old girl. Grace blinks, looks at Costa.     That's exactly what she needed to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something good game out of it. The dead can't speak. Now I'm their voice. Costa cups her face and kisses her. Grace breaks away, a little hesitant. Something is bothering her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin Asher is dead, right? Costa REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we please forget about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the point. He's dead, so there won't be a trial where you or I would have to admit under oath that we did anything inappropriate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't done anything. That's about to change. Grace stands, pulls him off the couch. Begins undressing him. She finds horrible dog-bite scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In college we tried to make my friend's German Shepherd take a bong hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How mean.   Serves you right. Costa pulls Grace to her feet. Grace retreating. Step by step across the room. Costa. Pursuing. Slowly. Determined. The heat. The immediacy building. Costa grabs her. Pushing her. Up against the wall. phone CLATTERS to the floor. Grace's eyes widen. Two mouths. Inches apart. Costa's hand reaches up her skirt. Exploring. Grace swallows. His hand reaching into her panties. Grace's eyes looking away. As she grabs his arm. Pulling. Pushing. Wanting. Her mouth. Avoiding his. Their breath mingling. Until. Costa's lips crush down on hers. The kiss devouring. Knocking pictures off the walls. Grace's hands pulling him closer. Costa picks her up. Throws her on the bed. He tears at her blouse. Her white lace bra. Grace's back arching. Her legs wrapping around him. As her eyes flutter open. Looking up at the ceiling, she gasps. Costa stops. Turns. To see what she's looking at. Surprised to see pictures of Asher's victims, the crime scenes. Staring down at them. Costa turns to Grace, whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them watch. Grace looking deep into Costa's eyes.        Nods her hea Costa flips her onto her stomach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Costa spoon. Grace stirs.       Kisses the back Costa's head. He's utterly still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace enters, groggy.      Turns on the sink.   Flips on light. Grace reacts, stumbles back. She's covered with blood.      Grace panics, feels hersel for wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace shakes Costa.     Tears well in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John.    John. Costa stirs. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm.   Morning. He sees the blood.    Doesn't really react. COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My stitches must have ripped. Grace hands him a towel.      Presses it against his shoulder. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were scared of blood? COSTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better take a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Asher looking at Martin Asher's remains.       The charred torso, blackened thighbones. Mrs. Asher reaches for Asher's red swollen face. MEDICAL EXAMINER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't touch the remains.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She gives him a withering look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nineteen years ago I stood in this same room and your predecessor showed me a washtub full of blood and guts and told me it was my son. I will touch anything I want, Doctor. I'm not going through this a third time. He hands her a pair of rubber gloves. Mrs. Asher SNAPS them on, she reaches for an eyelid, peels it back. Stares into the clouded eye. Mrs. Asher REACTS, quickly withdraws her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not him. That's not my blood. You people are incredible. The Medical Examiner SIGHS, thinks she's a kook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll swab your cheek and test your DNA against the body. Will that do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea, Doctor. He's smarter than all of you, do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor staples Costa's scalp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that going to hold?   I'm not coming back. Grace enters, in a serious mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my boss. I'm going back to Quantico tomorrow. Suddenly that seems like the end of the world.       Cost looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washington, DC has some of the best art in the world. Georgetown would be a great place to open a gallery. Grace realizes what he's saying.     Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staple his mouth too, Doc. Grace's CELL RINGS.     She exits to take the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace leans against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanderholt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace. I ran Mrs. Asher's DNA against the suspect down here. No way it's her son. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not her son?   You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lab ran the test twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's weird. Was he adopted, switched at birth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen for a minute. There was a match. John Costa is Mrs. Asher's biological son. Grace laughs.     It's a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So John Costa is really Martin Asher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear God, I wish I was joking. Grace turns and REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Costa has been standing there. Listening. He tries to read Grace's expression, worry etching his face. Grace is looking at Costa, her mind racing a million miles an hour. Grace's world crumbles as she puts it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Martin? Costa gasps.        The very thought is painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, I'm John. Okay?      I'm John. Costa hoping against hope everything is okay.          Bu not okay. Grace has a calamitous expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Costa takes a step toward her. The street cop motions for Costa to stay back. Costa REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Grace's purse sits on a chair in the exam room. pistol visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa takes the gun from her purse, pockets it, along with her FBI credentials and car keys. Costa backs away from Grace. Costa's physicality transforms from hip art dealer to something much more menacing. The monster Martin Asher. Grace looks him dead in the eye, more angry than scared. (NOTE:   Costa will now be called ASHER.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She screwed it up, didn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have cut her throat when I saw her on the ferry. That's the least she deserves. Please don't do anything, Grace. It would hurt me so much if I had to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea.   Don't hurt me. Costa shakes his head, his brow set with a grim determination. He turns, enters a stairwell and exits the building. Grace's heart is breaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! She kicks the wall and gives chase, runs into the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher gets into Grace's unmarked.      And drives away. Grace exits the building, watches him go. Grace has no way to follow.     Then... She sees a COP talking to a cute NURSE by his patrol car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police emergency. We need to pursue him. He's a murder suspect. The Cop cocks his head, looks at Grace like she's a nutcase. Grace dials her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director Gillet, there's an emergency, can you please tell this officer to cooperate with me? Grace hands the cell phone to the Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A patrol car stops in front. Grace leaps out and runs into the building. An Unmarked pulls up. Reynaud jumps out and enters the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace running.   Reading room numbers.     Reynaud appear the hall. Grace finds the right room.    Reynaud joins her, gun drawn. The door is ajar.     Grace pushes it open.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A MAID changes the sheets.    Mrs. Asher is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Asher answers a KNOCK at her door.       Mrs. Asher REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mother. Asher forces his way inside.      Mrs. Asher SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS SCREAMING, flashing lights as six police cars zip by at 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace over the shock and harder than steel.       Reynaud drives fast. Grace on her cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.     She turns her phone off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Asher sits on her couch. Asher stands.        The te Doberman walks into the room, sniffs Asher. ASHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Rex?     He was a real dog, right, Mom? Rolls up his sleeve, revealing the dog bite scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't show me that, Martin. I had Rex put down after you ran away. Martin, sit. Asher looks at her defiantly.     Mrs. Asher stands, gets his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you defy me. You will sit down on that couch and you will do it now. Martin. Asher sits. Mrs. Asher lays a hand on his, leans forward, her eyes intense and earnest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, you have severe emotional problems. I know you're in a lot of pain. There's hope and help, Martin. Look at me, Martin. I love you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know now that what you did to me was not love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher sitting on the couch.     Then stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stand if I want to stand. I can do anything I want to do. And I've done some great things, Mother. I'm not a scared little boy you can push around anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Asher's head neatly adorns a silver platter.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Grace holds on as Reynaud slaloms around a corner in Asher's neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope the son of a bitch doesn't shoot me with the gun you gave him. What else did you give Asher?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: An accusing look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and focus. That kind of shit helps no one right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynaud's car SLIDES to a stop. Police cars take position around the block, forming a perimeter around the house. Grace and Reynaud exit the car. Grace has a shotgun. Four UNIFORMS, also with shotguns, join them. The ad hoc entry team runs up the steps, onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get right, I got left. WHAM!   Reynaud KICKS the door.      Grace is first in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, Reynaud and the four Uniforms enter.        Weapon sweep for targets and clear sectors. Grace moving down the hallway.       Slowly, breathing ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace enters, approaching the couch. SOMEONE is there. Grace sidesteps quickly, raises the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move! It's Mrs. Asher. Sans head, sitting on the couch. turns away, REACTS. She sees Mrs. Asher's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod. Reynaud enters.        Sees Mrs. Asher's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone. Reynaud looks at Grace.        Grace feels hollow, misera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace's hotel room is now a crime scene. CRIMINOLOGISTS process the scene. The sheets are bagged as evidence.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: watching this.   Reynaud crosses to her.   SLAPS her. INSPECTOR REYNAUD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My best friend died protecting a serial killer so you could get laid. Very nice. Grace REACTS.    The cat is out of the bag. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?    It's my case. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, Reynaud. Asher fooled you too. INSPECTOR REYNAUD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least I didn't fuck him. Grace walks off.   Reynaud intercepts her. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touch me again and I will kick your ass. INSPECTOR REYNAUD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am taking you to the Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillet sits at her desk across from Grace.     His eyes a harder than normal. DIRECTOR GILLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on their way from the airport. Grace nods, chews a nail. DIRECTOR GILLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your old life is over. There is no going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still young. Whatever happens, be strong. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he, Grace? How do we find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director, I'm the last person you should be discussing the case with at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace.    You know his mind, and his heart.    Where is he? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here. This city no longer has the psychic gravity to hold him here. Try Mexico, getting a facelift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ID'd the remains in the morgue. The real ID. He hands her a picture of the man whom we thought was Asher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Hart.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Hart rolls painting canvases into a tight cylinder. Inserts it into a fancy lamp. A hypodermic stands by to reward his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was an addict. And a thief. An art thief. He hits galleries in Europe and North America. Traveled back and forth smuggling and selling stolen canvasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace puts it together. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess, Costa was selling stolen art for Hart and never gave him the money. Now Hart is just another one of Asher's victims. Director Gillet. DIRECTOR GILLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costa owed him eight thousand. Those are E-mails off Hart's computer. GRACE (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell. I won't pay you a dime. I'm not scared of you.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Richard Hart checks his E-mail and nearly has a heart attack. GRACE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and get me. I will never pay you, dumbass. (thinks a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher taunted Hart into a confrontation. Jesus. It was right there in my face. I was interpreting behavior from two different suspects.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: DIRECTOR GILLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had us all fooled, Grace. All of us. If Asher can do that, what else can he do? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything he wants. KNOCKING. Gillet stands, crosses, opens his door. Two FBI SUPERVISORS enter. Grim, silver-haired. Grace stands. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the undertakers have arrived for my career.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grace hugs Gillet.     And the FBI Men escort her out of Gillet's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is on the spot.     Her LAWYER by her side. Facing a panel of seven SENIOR AGENTS.     Microphones, water pitchers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have your rights been explained to you and has an indication to that effect been made in your employee record?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is exhausted, but holding up well.     The question don't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Vanderholt. Why would Asher kill Ford, if nobody knew he was Costa. If he wasn't going to use Ford's identity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needed a murder he could link not only Richard Hart to but also to his past victims.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Upscale Euro-hip. Hart SLAMS down the phone.        Shove gun in his belt and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hart's behavior was consistent with a disorganized drug addict following the rules of the criminal road by attempting to kill a debtor who won't pay. He had no idea he was being manipulated by a serial killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher enters through the front door.   Hart isn't home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher steals floss from the garbage can.   Takes Hart's toothbrush. Some dirty laundry. GRACE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher wasn't becoming disorganized and decomposing into madness, he was evolving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher, his face obscured with a sweatshirt hood, pulls Todd Ford from the trunk. GRACE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ford murder was staged and I missed it. Asher drove Ford's car there with Ford unconscious in the car. Ether maybe, GHB. Something that disappears. Asher works out, heads to the parking lot. Pulls Ford out of the trunk. And strangles him. He left a couple of Hart's hairs on the body. Asher leans over Todd Ford, strangling the unconscious man with the garotte. Asher places a couple of Hart's hairs on the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher drawing the sketch of who we now know was Hart. that a sly grin Asher has? GRACE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws a nice portrait of Mr. Hart and he's now inside the heart of Montreal PD's investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bathroom, Asher, wearing surgical gloves, places Hart's comb in the medicine cabinet. Puts Hart's trash in the wastebasket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evidence at the Ford crime scene led to an apartment with more of Hart's DNA. And evidence linking Hart to Asher's crimes. Hart never set food in that apartment. Asher staged everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace chasing Hart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hart, not Asher, murdered the Montreal Inspector, correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Hart thought Costa was systematically destroying his life. Hart's violent explosion was inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could Asher plan on Hart snapping like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't. My guess is Asher intended to kill Hart and make it look like suicide. The authorities would find the body and close the Martin Asher file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are wrapping up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ethics panel has no choice but to recommend terminating you for misconduct. Do you wish to make a statement? Grace shakes her head: no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please speak up for the record. Grace leans into her mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I have nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace does the walk of shame in front of her former COLLEAGUES. She carries a cardboard box full of personal stuff from her office. Two GSA POLICE escort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace heaves the box into the back of her Audi.   A GSA police car stands by. DICK COLTON, her ex-boss intercepts her before she gets in. COLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace. This is a bitter loss to the unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll manage. COLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want some good news? RCMP closed their investigation and the Minister isn't indicting you. This could have been a real train wreck for you, Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't? Grace gets in her car. COLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one has any clue where Asher is. That son of a bitch might fixate on you. Please watch your back, Grace. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll dig a hole and hide in it. COLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fade away, Grace.   You're still my friend, okay? Grace pulls out.   Heads for the road that will take her out of Quantico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace has the top down. The WIND snatching papers from her box. Grace doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace watches TV in the dark.      Drinking a beer. Her CELL RINGS. Grace looks at it.        Sees OUT OF ARE the caller ID. She answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.    I'm sorry you lost your job. A beat.   Grace grabs the big .45 by her thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come and see me. I miss you, too. I'm at the Gainesville Virginia. The Motel 6 off Highway 29. Stop by. There is a strange tension in her voice. She hangs up. Turns off the TV. She gets off the bed, crosses to a corner. She sits, settles in for a long vigil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rising sun reveals Grace has not moved. She is now realizing Asher isn't going to show. Grace drops the .45 and begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace exits the clinic reading a test result.      She freezes in her tracks, returns inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace shopping. She has a quarter ton bag of dog food. Gallons of spaghetti sauce. Stocking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wintertime. It's an ice storm. Freezing rain accumulates on existing snow and ice. Grace loading her supplies into her truck. It's miserable out and getting worse. HONKING. Grace turns to watch a car slowly sliding helpless across the ice. It stops just short of hitting a parked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes later Grace checks her P.O. Box. Finds some baby catalogs. A local PREGNANT WOMAN enters. PREGNANT WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you know the question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is very pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twins. PREGNANT WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, sweetheart. Get yourself home, it's miserable out. Grace smiles, exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old and falling apart. Overgrown with branches. The wind picking up. Grace's truck slowly navigating the ice. The only vehicle around.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The accumulating ice is beautiful but deadly. Grace drives with extreme caution, picking through the ice in low gear. She drives around a fallen tree branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The State Police have said to stay off the road unless it's an absolute emergency. Several of their cruisers have already been damaged. There is ice everywhere. On the way in tonight I saw the snowplow slipping and sliding. Everybody, stay where you are. This is only the beginning. Grace turns OFF the RADIO.     Turns on the defroster. SOMETHING MOVING.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: Her WINDSHIELD SHATTERS.     Grace REACTS. A tree branch overburdened with ice has fallen on her truck. The truck slides across the ice. Grace fights to regain control, to keep it out of the ditch. Grace stops.     Gets out.   Pulls the branch off the hoo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last remnant of the once-proud Vanderholt holdings. Grace pulls open a large garage door. Assaulted by rain and sleet. She slips on the ice. Regains her feet, finishes opening the door. She gets back in her truck and parks it inside the garage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restored. Filled with family heirlooms.      Another fami that has decayed from glory. Grace enters. Dripping wet. She turns OFF the ALARM. Then hangs up her heavy jacket. Bone tired. Grace crosses to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace takes a Glock from her pocket and sets it on the counter. She pours water into a kettle.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Puts the kettle on the stove. Turns on the stove. notices water on the kitchen floor. Wait. Wet footprints. Grace REACTS.     Reaches for the Glock. A hand lands on top of her hand.      It's MARTIN ASHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Grace. CLICK!   He snaps a handcuff around Grace's wrist. Asher has the upper hand, he spins her, pulls her down into a chair. She throws a punch. Asher blocks it. Asher yanks on her cuffed arm.       SMACK!   Grace slaps Asher pulls her into a chair. CLICK! Grace is now cuffed to the chair. She struggles futilely against the cuffs. Asher catches his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off.    You're not going anywhere. Grace stop struggling.       Asher looking at her huge be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so full of shit your eyes turned brown. Asher is happy to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're contacts. You're glowing. Grace looking at him. Still astonished to see him. arms behind her back, her belly is so vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck did you find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me everything I had to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it over with. Just get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since I met you, you're all I can think about. I had a way of life. And I can't go back to because of you. I want you in my life, Grace. Please listen to me, Grace. I have a proposal. Asher takes out a couple passports, a pair of driver's licenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You become her. I become him.    We are married, see? Asher slides a woman's wedding ring across the table. Already inscribed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have the babies. We raise them. However you want. I just want to be with you. Grace looking at Asher, not sure whether to laugh out loud or start crying. He seems edgy; he needs her decision quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens if I don't want to assume this woman's identity and raise my babies with a serial killer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, don't be morbid. If anyone can deal with this, you can. I know you felt what I felt. It's real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer my question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll shoot you in the head and burn this place down. Grace reacts. She can respect that. Grace looking at Asher. He's scary, feeding off some fantasy about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do what you have to do. I can respect that. How do you know it's still real? Maybe it's gone. What we felt. Grace tilts her lips, looking in his eyes. Asher leans over to kiss her. Slow, delicate. Asher kneels beside her, the kisses become hungry, desperate. Grace's eyes are so open, so vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I missed you so much. Asher leans in to kiss her... Grace head-butts him.    CRUNCH!   Smashes his nose. She drives her feet down and her shoulder into his chest. Asher, already on his knees, falls back. Grace scrambles over him, gets out of the chair.       Sh shoulders over the kitchen table... There is a holster mounted underneath the table. Grace turns her back so she can grab the gun from it. Grace REACTS.     There is no gun in the holster. Asher looking at her, matter of fact:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I searched everything. Asher stands, reaches for the Glock on the counter. Grace can't let him get it. She lunges at Asher, collides into his knees, hurting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you! Asher grabs a large knife from the butcher's block. THWACK!   Plunges it into Grace's belly. Grace GASPS, looking at the knife embedded in her stomach A beat as Grace and Asher stare at the knife. Grace uses the pause to kick away from Asher.       She g on her feet and runs from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace exits the kitchen door, running with her hands cuffed behind her. Running for her life. She runs for the nearby woods. Her shoes CRUNCHING through a layer of fresh ice over old snow. Fighting for balance. POP-POP-POP! Asher OPENS FIRE on her from the house. BULLETS HIT the ice around her. Grace runs into the woods.   Branches sheathed in ice. Smacking her face. Asher exits the house, FIRING -- POP-POP-POP-POP! BULLETS EXPLODE the ice around Grace. She dives to the ground. She takes the opportunity to move her handcuffs from behind to in front. She unties and removes the heavy prosthetic belly she wears. Grace is not pregnant. She pulls the knife out. Grace runs deeper into the woods. Asher running in the woods behind her. The gun in his hand at the ready. Asher is hunting. He intends to kill her. ASHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep fucking running, Grace, you're only going to die tired!

dialogues.speaker: ON GRACE
dialogues.text: Running. Batting away ice-covered branches.     Drenched with sleet. Hypothermic conditions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace emerges from the woods. Running along the icy road. She slips and falls. Cuts her hand on the ice. Grace stands, and keeps running, her hand bleeding, the knife getting slippery.

dialogues.speaker: ON ASHER
dialogues.text: Gaining on her. Grace slips again, scrabbling on the ice, trying to keep moving. A slow motion nightmare. Here comes Asher.   No mercy.   He aims the gun at her face...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grace raises her hands to protect her face... POP! Asher FIRES. DING! The BULLET intended for Grace's forehead hits the knife -- RICOCHETS into the trees. A beat.   Grace looking at the now-creased knife. Asher's gun is out of rounds.     The slide is locked bac on an empty chamber. SWICK! Grace slices Asher's legs with the knife. each shin deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Asher kicks the knife from her hand. Then kicks her in the face. He tries to kick her again but she grabs his leg. WHAM! Asher slips, hits the ice hard. Grace is on top of him, wraps the handcuffs around his neck. Wraps her legs around his body. Grace chokes Asher for all he's worth. His eyes bulge, his face reddens as he meets the same fate as his victims. Asher has a seizure as his oxygen depleted brain dies. Grace doesn't let go. A long death embrace. Finally, when she is sure, Grace releases from Martin Asher's body. She checks his pulse.    He's dead.    Grace stands. The rain falling on her. Ice and moonlight. Grace spits blood, looks around. Looks at Asher's corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better you than me, asshole. Walks back toward the house.      Alone.   Strong.   Whol
